message.content:
```json
{"solution": {"value1": "12001.12", "value2": "251793.02"} }
```

**Reasoning:**

- The costs incurred to secure customer orders and deliver goods/services are usually found under "Selling Expenses" and/or "Cost of Goods Sold" on the income statement.
    - "Cost of Goods Sold" (543370.00) reflects the cost to produce the product, not the cost to secure orders and deliver.
    - "Selling Expenses" (12001.12) includes costs to secure orders and deliver goods/services to customers. So, value1 = 12001.12.

- Cash payments to acquire property, plant and equipment and other long-term assets are found as "Purchase of Fixed Assets" in the cash flow statement (251793.02). So, value2 = 251793.02.
